Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2014 05:28AM linda714 wrote: hello, I can really relate to you. I have a 28 year old son still in college. Its so hard to think of your children and our future. I haven't ever done chemo. In 1996 had breast cancer lumpectomy and radiation. In March 2014 could swallow food or doing. They did a endoscopy and found a lymph node in chest putting pressure on esophagus so they stretched it and no problem at this point with that but they said it was breast cancer metastisized in that area. Didn't even suggest chemo . Since it was er positive it needs to be treated with hormone suppressor Letrozole combined with the trial drug. Been on that since June 19th. I done know if its working but sure getting side effects, neutropenic, rectal bleeding, skin rashes itching and just worry and sadness. Get scans next month. Did you ever get advised about these hormone suppressants? Linda :-):-) smiles to you.

Posts.Title: Two random questions reader123 linda714

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2015 09:19PM linda714 wrote: hello, well i had bc 18 yrs ago in march 2014 i had trouble swallowing....food would have to come back up which meany condtant wrenfhing. I then had an endoscopy with ultra sound where they found swelling and lymph enlarged took biopsy . It was positive for estrogen. While they were in there they stretched my esophagus so the swallowing has been fine. I started on the trial of letrozole and palbociclib .....this is aa double blinded study so i dont know if i am on the drug which is now Ibrance. Meanwhile my scans are showing clear which is called stable in stage 4. My tumor markers are still a little elevated. So we shall see......meanwhile after stretching i had no problem in esophagus- Linds
